Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah and Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) given the name Jedidiah (יְדִידְיָהּ) at his birth
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well being

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= process by which humans or animals stop living

Node.gloss: to cause hunger|to let (one) go hungry
Node.definition: = causative action by which a person is kept from having access to food
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil
= causative action by which someone cause someone else's plans to fail
= action by which humans behave as if they are poor and lack resources

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

literally: palm of the hand, but used in a figurative sense with the focus on the activities that are performed with one's hands; = someone's actions, whether or not performed with one's hands, for which one is personally responsible
= state or condition of a person unequipped or unwilling to work or be attentive to responsibilities
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= state in which humans are ready and prepared to act when needed
= to gather in one's crops

= hot season of the year, opposite of חֹרֶף (חֹרֶף) ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things

Node.gloss: to lie in a deep sleep
Node.definition: = state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
literally: remembrance; hence: = appellation through which one can be remembered
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
literally: to make (an event) crooked; hence: = causative action by which humans change something that is right into wrong
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= causative action by which humans close and open one eye quickly, ≈ which is associated with gloating and evil intent

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= a physical or emotional state of discomfort or anguish
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
hatred (between siblings)

Node.gloss: to rouse|to stir up|to raise|to stoke
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes an event to start taking place, ◄ as if it had been dormant or inactive for a certain time
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
literally: to cover; hence: = action by which humans or deities no longer hold (other) humans responsible for certain actions
= affection between people, or between people and deities

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: (a condition) is found (in someone); hence: = process by which humans are eventually discovered to have a certain condition or to be involved in a certain activity
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment
= the rear part of the human body, especially from the neck to the bottom
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action by which humans store valuable objects in a particular location ► in order to keep them in a good condition or to keep them safe
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which humans are in serious trouble, ◄ caused by a loss of status, health, wealth or a combination thereof
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an object is able to withstand force
= state in which objects are being broken or destroyed; ≈ often used figuratively to denote difficult circumstances
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which humans are willing to undergo a process

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
hatred (between siblings)
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

Node.gloss: to bring out a bad report
Node.definition: literally: to bring out a bad report; hence: = causative process by which humans publish bad information about something
= action by which humans give a verbal report concerning circumstances or events, usually with evil intentions
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= process by which events stop happening
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

Node.gloss: to withhold|to hold back|to be reluctant
Node.definition: = action by which humans keep part of their body to themselves, refusing to use it to perform a particular event

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= state in which an object has been selected for its superior quality
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= pertaining to being of relatively limited importance
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which humans are in lack of a particular quality that they are supposed to have|= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

literally: to add (an activity to someone else's activities); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities add additional activities to those that other humans or deities are currently engaged in
= action by which humans have to make a strong physical effort to complete a specific task, for one's own benefit or in service to another

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
literally: plan; hence: = a state of moral and ethical corruption, starting with evil plans and resulting in depraved practices, ≈ regarded as foolishness
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans experience a strong fear that certain things might happen to them
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans have a firm and lasting position within society, with the ability to deal with difficult circumstances
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= sour alcoholic liquid; ◄ by product of grape wine (יַיִן) and date wine (שֵׁכָר) due to acetous fermentation when it has been in contact with open air longer than necessary; ► used in diluted form as dip for bread, but to be avoided by Nazirites because of the alcohol; very unpleasant when it comes in contact with (bad) teeth and open wounds

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to add days or years to someone's life|to allow (someone) to live longer
Node.definition: literally: to add days or years; hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to live longer than expected
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans feel and show great joy

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which objects are being broken or destroyed; ≈ often used figuratively to denote difficult circumstances
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to be shaken; hence: = state in which humans are affected by difficult circumstances and feel worried and concerned

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
